content: page 1 scrappy felted oven mitts materials set of size 10 ½ double point needles 260 yds of bulky 100% wool yarn sample knit with lamb s pride bulky tapestry needle for weaving in loose ends pattern notes this pattern is a great way to use up scraps of left over bulky wool yarn from previous felting projects you can also use leftover worsted weight wools just hold the yarn doubled no color changes are included in the pattern instructions i like to alternate colors every two row which creates narrow stripes feel free to be creative and make these your own the mitts also look great in a solid color instructions make 2 body of mitten co 42 stitches and divide them evenly between three needles 14 stitches/needle work in stockinette stitch for 30 rounds finished products from this pattern are for personal use gifts or charity donations only copyright 2013 kelly schroeder page 2 round 31 k1 m1 k4 m1 knit to end of round round 32 and all even rounds knit all stitches round 33 k1 m1 k6 m1 knit to end of round round 35 k1 m1 k8 m1 knit to end of round round 37 k1 m1 k10 m1 knit to end of round round 39 k1 place 12 stitches on waste yarn co 4 stitches using the backward loop cast on method knit to end of round rounds 40-64 work in stockinette stitch round 65 *k5 k2tog* repeat ** to end of round round 67 *k4 k2tog* repeat ** to end of round round 69 *k3 k2tog* repeat ** to end of round round 71 *k2 k2tog* repeat ** to end of round round 73 *k1 k2tog* repeat ** to end of round round 75 k2tog to end of round break yarn and draw through stitches pull tight and secure thumb pick up 16 stitches from the thumb opening 12 held stitches plus 4 stitches from the back of the opening divide the stitches between three needles and join the yarn at the cast on edge of the thumb hole knit 12 rounds in stockinette round 13 *k1 k2tog* repeat ** to last stitch in round k1 round 14 knit all stitches round 15 k2tog to last stitch k1 break yarn and draw through remaining stitches pull tight and secure weave in loose ends felting instructions place the knit piece in the washing machine set to the heavy wash cycle with hot water and a small amount of detergent start the machine check the piece frequently continue to agitate the piece by repeating the wash cycle as often as necessary until the mitts are felted to your satisfaction spin out the remaining water shape the mitten while wet then allow it to dry completely key m1 make a stitch by knitting into the bar between stitches k knit co cast on k2tog knit 2 stitches together finished products from this pattern are for personal use gifts or charity donations only copyright 2013 kelly schroeder
